polls.question: How much programming everyone would need to know?
polls.answers: Wut is programming?--|--know what it is - have some idea--|--know to program in some language--|--know to program in several languages of different types/purpose--|--live programming--|--is there live out of programming?

comments.body:
Presumably interesting for twitter users...
Generally I would say no - i am not interested
but 
I find it a nice functionality since I haven't seen something like this on normal internet.
It really depends how it is implemented, because one tweet can be disussed anywhere but account... this is novel idea

Creating polls is tricky. Sometimes you wander did your questions really hit the right answers. 
Perhaps this question shall be re-phrased. Idea was to ask individual opinion on how much ONE BELIEVES that ALL OTHERS shall know.

If you casted your vote on different impression of question: on how much YOU need to know programming then I failed (most likely did).

concur to nipple, shall be setting of poller.
It really depends how question is made.

Before asking for opinion there shall be something that explains what it is in order to make informed decision.

I do not see much of explanation for justification of ZeroVerse.

it's nice to have safer system but for example how this is enforced?

There could be hundred of questions before someone can form an opinion.
despite numbers, humans are already half extinct. They are taken over by their smart phones.

1 answer polls could work if there is visible number of visits.
this would indicate participation. sometimes participation is only what's needed.
tricky part is what amounts to 'visit'?

Politically I am in Europe, geographically in Africa. Have no choice but Other.
Eurasia fails in the same category, it is geographical term.
